noun.description: A drug taken illegally for recreational purposes, especially marijuana or heroin.

examples: though he wasn't an intellectual giant, he was no dope either

noun.description: Information about a subject, especially if not generally known.
examples: our reviewer will give you the dope on hot spots around the town

noun.description: A varnish applied to the fabric surface of model aircraft to strengthen them and keep them airtight.

verb.description: Administer drugs to (a racehorse, greyhound, or athlete) in order to inhibit or enhance sporting performance.
examples: the horse was doped before the race

verb.description: Smear or cover with varnish or other thick liquid.
examples: she doped the surface with photographic emulsion

verb.description: Add an impurity to (a semiconductor) to produce a desired electrical characteristic.

phrases: they met to dope out plans for covering the event
origin: Early 19th century (in the sense thick liquid): from Dutch doop sauce, from doopen to dip, mix.
